title: Update check providing old version
author: clarkie82
body_snippet:
When clicking "Check for Updates", the installed version is higher than the latest version. 
The version I have installed is the latest stable version as per https://mremoteng.org/download
As such, the "latest" version in the check appears to be incorrect, and retrieving that data from https://mremoteng.org/update.txt

Is https://mremoteng.org/update.txt not being updated?

## Possible Solution
Use https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG.github.io/blob/master/_data/releases.json rather tha...

comments.snippet:
I changed my mRemoteNG.exe.config to use the below address - this address is as per https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/wiki/Release-Checklist
```
<applicationSettings>
    <mRemoteNG.Settings>
      <setting name="UpdateAddress" serializeAs="String">
        <value>https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/gh-pages/</value>
      </setting>

```
comments.author: clarkie82

comments.snippet:
I think the `gh-pages` commits does not trigger main website rebuild 
and probably this is related: https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/commit/acd2460c74c3a0c38d3f2a6d3de4ccde43a047d6
comments.author: v-karbovnichy

comments.snippet:
Given that the latest tag is 1.77.1 from 2019-09 (and the latest commit to develop was in 2020-06), is this project maintained? Do you have plans to release the unreleased changelog?

> Use https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG.github.io/blob/master/_data/releases.json

That does not have a 1.77.1 and calls 1.77.0 a pre-release.
comments.author: heinrichmartin

comments.snippet:
Just checked if that issue is present with 1.77.2-nb on Windows 10 21H2. 

I don't know how it's handled in the nightly build, though I get 'no updates available', and "Latest Version: 1.77.2\nLatest Version: 1.76.11.40527"

I guess there is an issue with displaying the current version with the tag "latest version", unless it's referring to nighly and stable release channels. In any case it's unclear what is what with the current information.

Further I would suggest to display the informa...

comments.snippet: its have some mess there what will be sort tonight - actually meaning is that latest is mean to be stable, but yes perhaps good idea to add info for all 3 channels

comments.snippet: Just stumbled across https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues/527#issuecomment-297805054, this might already lead into the right direction with multiple queries depending on what version is running. At the same time problems as described in #2541 should be handled better.
comments.author: simonai1254

comments.snippet: I just verified that if I download and run mRemoteNG 1.78.2-3207 and check for updates I still get "Update Available, Current Version is 1.76.11, you are running 1.78.2-3207") which is obviously incorrect. Therefore the update checker needs to be worked on so that works correctly and also takes the release channels properly into account.
comments.author: simonai1254

comments.snippet:
Triage refresh (P4 version-label debt): this issue is tagged with legacy version labels. Please retest on the latest build (fork v1.79.x or upstream dev), then share reproducible steps and expected vs actual behavior. If still valid, keep open and relabel to current triage scope (for example Need 2 check). If fixed, close with resolution.

Current legacy version labels: 1.77.2, 1.78.*
comments.author: robertpopa22
